column3: I'd suggest reverting interpreter.cpp, unless anyone strongly objects. Seeing those (albeit unused) static consts helped me to understand the script code more quickly.
@JeremyRubin Perhaps I should add them back but commented out. Sounds good? :-)

> I'd suggest reverting interpreter.cpp, unless anyone strongly objects. Seeing those (albeit unused) static consts helped me to understand the script code more quickly.\n\nAgree, let's just put those back. There is zero overhead to defining a few extra constants for clarity even if unused.
`GetKeySize` is referenced in the comment in `src/coins.h`.
@paveljanik Good point! Reference in `src/coins.h` removed. Squashed and pushed as well :-)

We probably want to keep this one around for symmetry.\nSometimes blindly removing unused code can cause an API to become lopsided, and cause methods to go missing which clearly will have a use at some point, and it just indicates more tests are needed. This seems applicable here.
Either keep everything or remove the member as well, no?
